title: Gallo-Roman Sanctuary at Bû
description: Remains of a rectangular Romano-Celtic temple were excavated north of the French town of Bû (in the department of Eure-et-Loir), beginning in the 1960s. Other buildings of uncertain nature and a theater were also identified in the vicinity. Coins and pottery discovered at the site indicate there was activity there during the Roman imperial period.

properties.description: Representative point marking the center of visible remains of the sanctuary as observed in Google Earth, after Monumentum. Dates after BAtlas and Horne.
properties.title: Imagery Location of Visible Remains
